channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Apple could charge up to $20 for some Apple Intelligence AI features, analysts say
item.description: Apple plans to rollout Apple Intelligence, its forthcoming AI system, across some of its devices later this year.

item.title: State of emergency declared after Moscow says Ukrainians launched raid into Russian border region
item.description: A state of emergency has been declared in Kursk following a Ukrainian incursion into the Russian border region.

item.title: Siemens earnings beat estimates on strong demand for electrification, software
item.description: German industrial technology giant Siemens on Thursday posted better-than-expected quarterly operating profit and confirmed its full-year outlook.

item.title: Italy looks like fertile ground for a mega merger deal in banking
item.description: Years after a debt crisis in the region and a government rescue for Banca Monte dei Paschi, analysts are looking at Italy's banking sector with fresh eyes.

item.title: Banks face tough new security standards in the EU — their tech suppliers are under scrutiny, too
item.description: By January 2025, banks and their tech suppliers will have to comply with a new EU law known as DORA. It could help prevent major IT disruptions in future.

item.title: China's exporters enjoyed the benefits of a weak yuan. Now that's changing and cutting into profits
item.description: Chinese companies seeking growth from exports face a new challenge: a strengthening yuan.

item.title: India's Nifty 50 is outperforming the S&P 500 so far this year
item.description: The South Asian benchmark has surged 11.5% so far this year, outpacing the S&P 500's 8.7% gain, and crossed the 25,000 level for the first time last week.

item.title: Hamas' new political leader Yahya Sinwar is seen as more extreme — and less willing to compromise
item.description: Haniyeh's killing has led to a much more hard-line leader for Hamas, likely dealing a severe blow to chances of a cease-fire.

item.title: Russia hates on the Olympic Games, relishing 'scandals' and controversy in Paris
item.description: Russia's media has shunned coverage of the Olympic Games in Paris — unless something has been controversial or gone wrong.

item.title: Putin accuses Ukraine of 'large-scale provocation' at the Russian border
item.description: Russia President Vladimir Putin accused Ukraine on Wednesday of carrying out what he called "yet another large-scale provocation" at the Russian border.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: Wall Street rebound fizzles out
item.description: Wall Street's comeback attempt fizzles out. JPMorgan's Dimon sees recession ahead. Warner Bros. sinks on $9.1 billion write-down.

item.title: Jamie Dimon says he still sees a recession on the horizon
item.description: Dimon, leader of the biggest U.S. bank by assets and one of the most respected voices on Wall Street, has warned of an economic "hurricane" since 2022.

item.title: China will have nearly twice the pets than young children by 2030, Goldman Sachs says
item.description: The country's urban pet population is set to hit over 70 million by the end of the decade, while the number of children under the age of four will dwindle to less than 40 million.

item.title: SoftBank swings back to gains at Vision Fund tech arm, announces up to $3.4 billion share buyback
item.description: SoftBank announced it would buy back up to 6.8% of shares available amounting to up to 500 billion yen ($3.4 billion).

item.title: No sign of U.S. recession in freight demand, CEO of shipping giant Maersk says
item.description: U.S. inventories "are not at a level that is worrisome or that seems to indicate a significant slowdown right in the offing."

item.title: Consumer giants from Starbucks to General Mills have one big sales problem: China
item.description: A theme emerging in the latest slew of U.S. companies' earnings reports is a drag from the China market.

item.title: As inflation fury lingers, politicians join customers in pushing companies to cut prices
item.description: Companies like Kroger, Walmart and McDonald's are getting caught in the political messaging around inflation ahead of the 2024 election.

item.title: In a reversal, Disney's media assets are starting to generate more excitement than its parks
item.description: For the first time in more than two years, Disney's media assets are outshining the parks division.

item.title: Sahm Rule creator doesn't think that the Fed needs an emergency rate cut
item.description: She said, however, there is a good case for a 50 basis point cut, adding that the Fed needs to "back off" its restrictive monetary policy.

item.title: An airline now allows women to avoid sitting next to men. Here's how travelers are reacting
item.description: Indian airline IndiGo is trialing a booking feature that allows women to see the genders of passengers when they book their seats, the company said.

item.title: Sony rules out renewing offer for Paramount, says it wouldn't fit strategy
item.description: Hiroki Totoki, Sony's chief financial officer, said the tech giant has no plans to submit a revised offer for Paramount.

item.title: Google's antitrust ruling has experts looking to 25-year-old Microsoft case for answers
item.description: The historic antitrust case against Microsoft in 1999 provides some clues as to what Google can expect after Monday's ruling.

item.title: Elon Musk slammed by British government after comments on UK riots
item.description: The U.K. government hit back at Elon Musk after the billionaire made controversial comments about far-right riots taking place across the country.

item.title: Elon Musk ‘accountable to no one,’ UK tech minister says amid disinformation during riots
item.description: Elon Musk can't be held to account by anyone, the U.K.'s technology minister said, adding to criticisms of the billionaire from government officials.

item.title: Disney beats estimates as combined streaming services turn a profit
item.description: Disney beat estimates as its combined streaming businesses — Disney+, Hulu and ESPN+ — turned a profit for the first time.

item.title: Novo Nordisk shares dip as Wegovy maker posts earnings miss, cuts operating profit outlook
item.description: Novo Nordisk on Wednesday announced its second quarter earnings for 2024.

item.title: China's exports miss expectations in July, while imports pick up with growth of 7.2%
item.description: China's imports grew faster-than-expected in July, while export growth came in below forecasts, according to customs data released Wednesday.

item.title: Beyonce, PlayStation games help Sony post a 10% jump in profits
item.description: Sony reported a 10% jump in operating profit in the fiscal first quarter, beating analyst expectations.

item.title: The popular 'carry trade' is unwinding — and economists fear Fed rate cuts could make matters worse
item.description: The warning comes as market participants seek to aggressively roll back on carry trades following a dramatic global sell-off in risk assets.

item.title: Correction in the dollar-yen was overdue and may be 'healthy' for markets, former ECB chief says
item.description: "Everybody knew that the yen was not in an appropriate position," Jean-Claude Trichet told CNBC.
